xs:annotation.xs:documentation: Schema defining the Selection Query XML language. All elements in the schema may be referred to by using the id and ref attributes. When using the ref attribute in an element, all other attributes and child elements are ignored and should not be specified. To indicate that an attribute or a child element is "required" when not using a reference, the keyword "mandatory" is used throughout this documentation.
Represents any element that can act as a filter.
Represents any element that can act as a value.
Represents any element that can act as a query.
End of group definitions Start of attribute group definitions
Unique identifier of the element within the document, can be referenced through the ref attribute
Reference to another element of the document through the id attribute value. When present, all other attributes are ignored and should not be set, even those usually described as mandatory.
Free text attribute that can be used by a specific engine to identify elements being processed.
Flag indicating if the value should be bound to the query (? in SQL) or included into it.
Mandatory. Unique identifier of the query in the resulting SQL statement.
Represents all custom fields of a given type for the class targeted by the given path.
Mandatory. Path targeting the entity for which all custom fields must be considered. Same definition as field path attribute.
Mandatory. Type of custom fields to be considered. Custom fields of other types will be excluded.
Represents an amount value: a number with its currency.
Represents a boolean value.
Represents a type of class. It can represent a specific class type by specifying the "type" attribute or the type of the targeted entity by specifying the "path" attribute.
Path targeting the entity type onto which the filtering/sorting/... will be applied. Same definition as the field path attribute.
Specific entity type onto which the filtering/sorting/... will be applied. Same definition as the query projected class attribute.
Represents an unilingual database column of a given name for the table targeted by the given path. Generally used when a column is not mapped to the entity model.
Path targeting the entity owning the database column (mandatory)
The name of the column in the physical data model (mandatory)
Type of the database column in case it is not unilingual.
Represents an multilingual database column of a given name for the table targeted by the given path. Generally used when a column is not mapped to the entity model.
Path targeting the entity owning the database column (mandatory)
The name of the column in the physical data model (mandatory)
Represents a currency value. The value must be a valid ISO-4217 code.
Deprecated. Type of currency.

Represents a custom expression that will be sent as is to the engine processing it. Formatted values can refer to parameters of the value or of the search context. To do so, the following notation must be used within the formatted value: :parameter_name .
The base value of the custom element (mandatory)
Name of the parameter. That name is used to reference the parameter in the pre-formatted expression.

Represents an already formatted value that will be sent as is to the engine processing it. Formatted values can refer to parameters of the value or of the search context. To do so, the following notation must be used within the formatted value: :parameter_name .

Represents an already formatted filter that will be sent as is to the engine processing it. Formatted filters can refer to parameters of the filter or of the search context. To do so, the following notation must be used within the formatted filter: :parameter_name .
Represents a date value that can refer to the current time (SYSDATE in SQL) or a specific one.
Represents the type of date value.
Represents a specific date. If this option is selected, then an explicit value must be provided for the element.
Represents the current system date and time as in the SYSDATE SQL expression. If this option is selected, then no value is required for the element.
This attribute is deprecated, use the add element with an integer value (in days) to modify a date.
This attribute is deprecated, use the add element with an integer value (in days) to modify a date.
This attribute is deprecated, use the toStartOfTherDay or toEndOfTheDay to modify a date. The function truncates the time information to either the start or the end of the current day.
Format given to the java function to format the date.
Format given to the Oracle to_date function.
Represents a double value.
Represents a BigDecimal value.
Represents a field of the entity model. The field is defined by its path from the projected class of the current query.

Represents the path of the returned field as a comma-delimited list of relations followed by a single field name (also comma-delimited). If the path ends with a relation, then the internal key of that relation will be returned.
Locale handling for multi-lingual fields.
Return the value only for the default locale specified globally for the query.
Return the value for the locales explicitly specified in the locales attribute.
Return the value for the first prioritized locale in the current search context (internal use only).
Return the value for the first prioritized locale in the current search context (internal use only).
Return the value for the first active prioritized locale in the current search context (internal use only).
Return the value for the first active prioritized locale in the current search context (internal use only).
Return the value for all available locales.
Return the value for the preferred locale and fallback to the base locale if no value is found (internal use only).

Represents a comma-separated list of locales to use when the customLocales option is selected for the localeFiltering attribute. This value is ignored for any other value of that attribute (including the default value of defaultLocale).

Overrides the scope of the current query with a reference to another query using its alias attribute value. The path of the field will thus be relative to the projected class of the specified query and not the current query.
Represents a float value.
Represents an integer value.
Represents a key value. It can represent a specific key value by specifying the "value" attribute or the key of the targeted entity by specifying the "path" attribute.
Path targeting the entity owning the key.
Specific key value.
Represents a list of values.
Represents a locale value. The value must be based on valid ISO-3166 and ISO-639 codes.
Represents a long value.
Represents an expression to compute an aggregate value over a range of values or rows. In SQL terms, it computes the aggregate value using an analytic function (OVER clause).
Flag indicating if the value precedes or follows the current row.
Flag indicating if the value precedes or follows the current row.
Represents an expression to compute an aggregate value over a range of rows. In SQL terms, it computes the aggregate value using an analytic function (OVER clause).
Represents an expression to compute an aggregate value over a range of values. In SQL terms, it computes the aggregate value using an analytic function (OVER clause).
Represents a way to refer to dynamic values coming from the search context. Frequently used for query/filter templates.
Name of the parameter. (Mandatory)
Represents a string value.
Flag indicating if the string must be considered/escaped as an intermedia string.
Represents the SQL CASE clause. It finds the corresponding value by checking case criteria. If it matches, it returns the return value; otherwise it returns null or the default value if specified.
Collection that holds the cases.
A case is made of a criterion followed by a value: the case criterion that will be checked and the return value that will be returned if the case criterion matches.
Default value if no case match.

Represents the SQL CASE clause. It finds the corresponding value by comparing case values against the base value. If it matches, it returns the return value; otherwise it returns null or the default value if specified.
Base value against which case values are compared..
Collection that holds the cases.
A case is made of two values: the case value that will be compared against the base value and the return value that will be returned if the case value matches.
Default value if no case match.
Deprecated. Represents a place holder for a value. A parameter should be used instead of this element.
Represents a query for a specific entity. This is the main element of the schema, although not always the root element.
Collection that holds the sub-queries.
Collection that holds the projections
Collection that holds the projection filterings.
Collection that holds the projection sortings.
Collection that holds the filterings.
Collection that holds the rankings.
Collection that holds the sortings.
Collection that holds the sorting filterings.
Collection that holds the groupings.
Collection that holds the joinings.
Specifies the main entity of the query, all path attributes start at this point (mandatory)
Flag indicating if duplicates must be filtered out. Only available for sub or report queries.

Path targeting the starting table of the query. Only fields part of the starting table can be referenced in the query. As an example, the starting path could contain a N-N relation to start the query from the intersection table.
Oracle SQL hint to include after the SELECT clause.
Name of the temporary table to store temporarily the results. Performance feature to use carefully.
Flag indicating if the temporary table is refreshed with the query results. Performance feature to use carefully.
Any query predefined for the meta-class.
Unique query name in the meta-class scope.
Mandatory. Specifies the entity of the query.
Represents a view built by applying an operator to queries. Results can also be sorted.
Collection that holds the queries.
Collection that holds the sortings.
Represents a view on rows returned in all queries (intersection). Results can also be sorted.
Represents a view on rows from the first query minus those from other queries (exclusion). Results can also be sorted.
Represents a view on rows returned by at least one query. Duplicates are removed in that case. Results can also be sorted.
Represents a view on rows returned by at least one query. Duplicates are not filtered. Results can also be sorted.
Represents a field or value that is returned by a query (mandatory). This element will be translated in the SQL SELECT clause.

Represents the sorting order for this value. The default value of true sorts the value in ascending order (ASC SQL keyword), the other possible value of false sorts in a descending order (DESC SQL keyword).
Represents the value that will be returned (mandatory)

Unique identifier of the element in the resulting SQL statement. This value is used to distinguish query elements that use the same model entities or fields. It is also used to name the output value (similar to the AS SQL keyword) in report type formats. An alias is required for projections that do not directly refer to a entity field.
Oracle type used to group multiple values into a single row (CAST MULTISET). The inner value must be a query in order to group values.
Path of the field to whom the value will be set. Used to reroute a value or to indicate the field that will store the computed value.
Type of value. Overrides the type of the field associated to the projection.
Deprecated. Use the corresponding aggregate function instead (count, max, etc.).
Represents a filter used to indicate which related elements (collection) of returned elements must be loaded. This element will be translated in the SQL WHERE clause of the entity information query.
Represents the filter applied on the projected values (mandatory)
Represents a filter used to indicate which elements to return. This element will be translated in the SQL WHERE clause of the entity selection query.
Represents the filter applied on the selected entities (mandatory)
Flag indicating if the filter must be rerouted to the Search Procedure visitor.
Represents a value used to order results. This element will be translated in the SQL ORDER BY clause.
Represents the value used for projection sorting (mandatory)

Represents the sorting order for this value. The default value of true sorts the value in ascending order (ASC SQL keyword), the other possible value of false sorts in a descending order (DESC SQL keyword).
Flag indicating if null values must be sorted to the end.
Flag indicating if values must be sorted considering the linguistic locale.
Linguistic locale by which multilingual values will be sorted.
Represents a filter used to prioritize elements that match the criteria without excluding those that don't.
Represents the filter applied to rank the selected entities (mandatory)
Flag indicating if the filter must be rerouted to the Search Procedure visitor.
Flag indicating if filterings must be added to each ranking sub-query.
Represents a value used to order results. This element will be translated in the SQL ORDER BY clause.
Represents the value used for sorting (mandatory)

Represents the sorting order for this value. The default value of true sorts the value in ascending order (ASC SQL keyword), the other possible value of false sorts in a descending order (DESC SQL keyword).
Flag indicating if null values must be sorted to the end.
Flag indicating if values must be sorted considering the linguistic locale.
Linguistic locale by which multilingual values will be sorted.
Represents a filter used to exclude rows for a query sorting. This element is used for internal optimization purposes.
Represents the filter applied to sort the selected entities (mandatory)
Represents a value used to group results. This element will be translated in the SQL GROUP BY clause.
Represents the value to use for this grouping (mandatory)
Represents a filter used to indicate which elements to consider in the grouped results. This element will be translated in the SQL HAVING clause of the entity selection query.
Mandatory. Represents the filter applied on the grouped results.
Represents a hierarchical filter used to recursively retrieve elements. This element will be translated in the SQL CONNECT BY clause of the entity selection query.
Represents the hierarchical filter to link the parent with the child. This element will be translated in the SQL CONNECT BY clause of the entity selection query.
Mandatory. Represents the filter used for the hierarchy.
Represents the start with filter to for the hierarchical filtering. This element will be translated in the START WITH clause of the entity selection query.
Mandatory. Represents the filter used for the start with.
Represents a filter used to join a sub-query to its parent query. This element will be translated in the SQL WHERE clause of the parent query, but it must be associated to the sub-query.
Mandatory. Represents the filter to use for this joining.
Represents a function applied to one value to compute the resultant value.
Represents a function applied to one value to compute the resultant value that is boundable.
Represents a function that can act as an unary to a binary function.
Mandatory
Represents a function that can act as an unary to a tertiary function.
Mandatory
Represents a function applied to two values to compute the resultant value.
Mandatory
Represents a function applied to two values to compute the resultant value.
Mandatory
Represents a function applied to three values to compute the resultant value.
Mandatory
Represents a custom function applied to n values to compute the resultant value.
The SQL language name of the function to use (mandatory)
Represents the SQL addition operator (+). The types of the operands must be compatible.
Represents the SQL + function on a date value.
Represents the SQL add_months function.
Represents the SQL + function on a date value (right value multiplied by 7 as there are seven days in a week).
Represents the SQL add_months function (right value multiplied by 12 as there are 12 months in a year).
Represents the SQL AVG function
Represents the SQL CAST function.
Represents the SQL CAST function.
Represents the SQL CAST function.
Represents the SQL concatenation operator (||)
Represents the SQL COUNT function
Represents a function that is not predefined. The custom function name will be included as is in the SQL query and parameters will surround function values.
Represents the SQL DECODE function.
Represents the SQL division operator (/). The types of the operands must be compatible.
Represents the SQL FIRST_VALUE analytic function.
Represents the SQL GREATEST function.
Represents the CASE MULTISET function.
The type of the Group.
Represents the SQL LAST_VALUE analytic function.
Represents the SQL LEAST function.
Represents the SQL DBMS_LOB.COMPARE function
Mandatory
Represents the SQL DBMS_LOB.INSTR function.
Mandatory
Represents the SQL DBMS_LOB.LENGTH function.
Represents the SQL DBMS_LOB.SUBSTR function.
Represents the SQL MAX function
Represents the SQL MIN function
Represents the SQL multiplication operator (*). The types of the operands must be compatible.
Represents the SQL LEAD analytic function.
Represents the SQL POWER function.
Any value predefined for the current meta-class.
Unique name in the meta-class scope.
Path to the specific entity for which the value is built.
Represents the SQL LAG analytic function.
Represents the SQL REPLACE function.
Represents the SQL NVL function.
Represents the SQL NVL2 function.
Represents the SQL ROUND function
Represents the SQL SUBSTR function.
Represents the SQL substraction operator (-). The types of the operands must be compatible.
Represents the SQL substraction operator (-) for a date time data type. The types of the operands must be a date.
Represents the SQL SUM function
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents function related to the Oracle Text feature.
Represents the SQL TO_CHAR function.
Represents the SQL TRUNC/CAST function and the necessary increment to shift the date value to the last second of the day
Represents the SQL TRUNC/CAST function to shift the date value to the first second of the day
Represents the SQL TRIM function
Represents the SQL TRUNC function
Represents the SQL LOWER function
Represents the SQL UPPER function
Represents a function applied to n values to compute the resultant value.
Represents a logical operator applied to one filter to determine if the condition is met.
Mandatory
Represents the SQL NOT logical operator
Represents a logical operator applied to two filters to determine if the condition is met..
Mandatory
Represents the SQL AND logical operator
Represents the SQL OR logical operator
Represents a custom logical operator applied to n filters to determine if the condition is met.
Mandatory
Represents an operator applied to one value to determine if the condition is met.
Mandatory
Represents the SQL "= 0" operator.
Represents the SQL IS NOT NULL operator.
Represents the SQL IS NULL operator.
Represents the SQL "= 1" operator.
Represents the SQL EXISTS operator.
Represents an operator applied to two values to determine if the condition is met.
Mandatory
Selects values if the provided expression is contained in the value.
Same behavior as the contains operator, but ignores the case of the value.
Represents the SQL = operator.
Represents the SQL (+)= operator.
Represents the SQL NOT IN operator.
Represents the SQL > operator.
Represents the SQL >= operator.

Represents a hierarchical operator that marches if the given relation (first value) targets a composite element contains the given composite element (second value). It uses denormalized tables only supported by specific entities. Oracle CONNECT BY operator will be supported in the future.

Represents a hierarchical operator that marches if the given relation (first value) targets a composite element contains or is within the given composite element (second value). It uses denormalized tables only supported by specific entities. Oracle CONNECT BY operator will be supported in the future.

Represents a hierarchical operator that marches if the given relation (first value) targets a composite element that is within the given composite element (second value). It uses denormalized tables only supported by specific entities. Oracle CONNECT BY operator will be supported in the future.
Represents the SQL IN operator.
Represents the Oracle Text CONTAINS operator.
Represents the SQL < operator.
Represents the SQL <= operator.
Alias for the matches operator.
Alias for the matchesIgnoreCase operator.
Represents the SQL LIKE operator. Matches the value with a search expression using two wildcards: ? for exactly one character and * for any number of characters.
Same behavior as the matches operator, but ignores the case of the value.
Represents the SQL REGEXP_LIKE operator.
Same behavior as the matchesRegex operator.
Represents the SQL <> operator.
Any filter predefined for the current meta-class.
Unique name in the meta-class scope.
Path to the specific entity for which the filter is built.
Represents an operator applied to three values to determine if the condition is met.
Mandatory
Represents the SQL BETWEEN operator.
Represents an operator applied to n values to determine if the condition is met.
Represents a custom operator applied to n values to determine if the condition is met.
Mandatory. Pre-formatted name of the operator to use.

Represents a user-defined selection in akirax
Indicates if this selection should be ordered alphabetically or not.
Associated CustomSelectionElement for this CustomSelection.
This entity represents an element of a custom-made selection. The description of this element is stored in TextTool resources.
The position at which this element should be ordered in the selection.
Associated CustomSelection for this CustomSelectionElement.
This entity links a selection to a metafield that uses it. The metafield is usually a custom field created by the client.
The physical key identifying this entity.
Associated CustomSelection for this CustomSelectionUsage.
This entity defines how many values a custom field may contain.
This entity defines the data types a custom field may contain.

A unique, alphanumeric code uniquely identifying a given status.
Base class for all administrable entities.
Unique identifier providing a meaningful key
Name of the Administration Entity (mutlilingual)
Reference to the Administration Entity status of the administration entity
Generic entity to provide a tree structure data
Unique identifier providing a meaningful key
Indicates the level where the composite is located in the tree structure. The level of the root of the tree structure is 0. It's a read-only calculated field.
Name of the composite (mutlilingual)
Unique identifier generated by the system

This class serves as a common ancestor for all multilingual, administrable entities. It defines fields and methods that should be common across all those entities.
Indicates if the given language is active (or usable). Inactive languages are seen only when administering an entity, and are not considered usable throughout the system.

Indicates if the given language is the base language for this entity.
The entity must have a base language, and that language must also be supported by the entity.
This class serves as a common ancestor for all multilingual entities. It defines fields and methods that should be common across all those entities.
Indicates if the given language is active (or usable). Inactive languages are seen only when administering an entity, and are not considered usable throughout the system.
Indicates if the given language is the base language for this entity. The entity must have a base language, and that language must also be supported by the entity.
Object origin entity Determines the origin of an entity.
Code of the Object origin entity
Generic entity to provide specification of the different levels of any tree structure
Unique identifier allowing providing a meaningful key
Refers to the level of depth in the tree structure. First visible level will be 1 and root is considered as being at level 0 (not visible)
Name of the level (multilingual)
Indicates whether the level is visible or not
Reference to the Administration Entity Status of the structure level.
Timezone accordingly to the meridian you are living
Unique identifier generated by system
Identification of the timezone
BaseHierarchy is an abstract class providing an hierarchical tree structure.
The level of the element in the hierarchical tree structure from the root. The root level in the tree structure is 0. The deeper the element is in the hierachy, the higher the level will be.

A certification is one element that defines the talent profile of a candidate or employee. The notion of certification refers to an official recognition of skills and knowledge in a specific area. A certification is emitted by an authorized provider.
All certifications are defined in the standard Taleo library - it is not possible for customers to add new elements. However, customers can activate/deactivate elements.
The creation date of the entity
This attribute describes the certification.
The date of the last modification of the entity
This attribute is the certification identifier. Use the Number to search and identify the certification to update.
To be documented.
The Administration Entity status of the administration entity

This entity is used as a log container for entities that are tracked for their deletion. Such entities will generate entries in this entity when they are deleted. See DeletedEntityType for the tracked entity types.
The no of the deleted entity
The delation date of the entity
The types of entities that generated log entry.

Types of entities that generates log entries on deletion.
removeCheckOnUpdateFields=true)
The code of the DeletedEntityType

This class represent the Employee bonus historical data
If your zone is already configured to use the "Compensation" application, you can only view this entity in read-only mode. No editing actions are allowed. Please note that data will be automatically extracted from "Compensation".
The bonus plan
The code (identifier) of the BonusHistory
The date at which the BonusHistory is effective.
The payment amount
The payment percent
The target amount
The target amount
The Compensation History of the BonusHistory
The currency of the bonus history

The Employee's current compensation data. Each employee can have only one record that contains his latest compensation data. Without this record, no other history data can be added (bonus, salary or stock).
If your zone is already configured to use the "Compensation" application, you can only view this entity in read-only mode. No editing actions are allowed. Please note that data will be automatically extracted from "Compensation".
The current compratio
The current currency
To be documented.
To be documented.
The salary history items
The currency
The employee
The salary history items
The stock history items

The code (identifier) of the SalaryHistory
The date at which the SalaryHistory is effective.
The increase amount
The increase percent
the increase type

This class represent the Employee stock historical data.

The code (identifier) of the StockHistory
The grant amount
The grant date
The grant type

Total unvested shares
The compensation history
A competency is knowledge, a skill or an ability. Competencies are contained in the Taleo Competencies List.
Customer specific multilingual competency name.
Multilingual description of the competency. This field supports rich-text markup. Descriptions may also be contextualized to specific OLF values using competency definitions.
Multilingual plain text version of the description.
Taleo unique identifier used as entity key.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The competency categories associated to the competency.
The competency definitions associated to the competency.
The competency group associated to the competency.
Competency provider associated to the competency.
Customer specific competency type associated to competency.
Default competency type associated to competency.
Network job fields associated to Competency.
Primary network job field associated to Competency.
Rating model associated to Competency.
Sub-competencies associated to the competency.
A competency category is a way for classifying competencies. Competencies are mainly used for filtering purposes. A competency can be associated to many categories.
The multilingual description of the competency category.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The competencies associated to the competency category.
A Competency Definition provides a specific description for an associated context. It overrides the default competency description when the competency is used within a specific context.
The competency associated to the competency definition.
A competency group is a way for classifying competencies. Groups are mainly used for filtering and display grouping purposes. A competency can be associated to one group.
The multilingual description of the competency group.
The display sequence of the competency group.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
A competency provider owns a library of competencies and other related content that can be used by the client.
The description of the competency provider
The parent competency provider.
Competency types provide a way to group and organize competencies. There are three types of competencies: job specific, language, and behavioral competencies.
Unique identifier of the competency type.
A rating dimension offers a scale of values to select from to evaluate a competency or goal. The rating dimension type determines the usage pattern of this part of the evaluation.
The description of the rating dimension.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The internal unique identifier.
The provider of the Rating Dimension
The rating dimension type associated to rating dimension.
Rating values associated to rating dimension.

The rating dimension type determines the usage pattern of this part of the evaluation.
The types LEVEL, INTEREST, EXPERIENCE and LAST_USED represent the dimensions also used in the recruiting product and candidate profiles. The SCORE dimension is the one mainly used in the Performance Management product for performance reviews.
The unique identifier of the rating dimension type.
A rating model is a set of rating dimensions each representing an aspect of the evaluation. A rating model is used to evaluate a business item, typically a competency but other uses are supported.
The description of the rating model.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The provider of the Rating Model
The rating dimensions associated to the rating model.
A rating model is defined by a set of rating dimensions each representing an aspect of the evaluation. The rating model dimension lists the rating dimensions associated to a rating model.
Rating dimension display sequence.
The internal unique identifier.
The rating dimension associated to the rating model.
The rating model associated to the rating dimension.
The rating value is a qualitative and quantitative (numerical) way of describing an evaluation state on a rating dimension scale.
Defines the order in which to display the rating values (may or may not correspond to the numerical value sequence)
The name or display label of the rating value.
The internal unique identifier.
The numerical value corresponding to this rating value - mandatory as it is used in the aggregation and normalization calculations.
A rating dimension offers a set of rating values to select from for the evaluation.
A sub-competency is a constituent element of a competency. It describes a competency with more granularity.
Sub-competency display sequence.
Customer specific sub-competency multilingual name.
The provider of the SubCompetency
The competency associated to the sub-competency.
A required or asset certification.
The certification used in this requirement.
The job profile of this requirement.
A required or asset competency.
The competency used in this requirement.
The job profile of this requirement.
To be documented.

Job codes are meant as a convenience way to map several customer job codes to one defined in Taleo. This concept is optional and mainly for use for system to system integration. Job codes are only available for management through the Connect interface.
The unique identifier of the external job code.
Job Level lookup values. It determines the available job levels in the system.
The job profile that specifies the requirements to execute a job.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
Set of required or asset certifications.
Set of required or asset competencies.
A specific requirement for a job profile
The display sequence for the requirement.
The relative weight of the requirement.
The relative importance of the requirement.

A job role is a generic definition of job that applies to all employees - as opposed to a position, which is a specific instance of a job. Actually, a position can be defined as a job role joined to an organization and a location. A job role has a code, name and definition for documentation purposes and also supports the concept of a job profile that specifies the requirements to execute the job.
The JobRole internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a job role identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
A job role has a code, name and definition for documentation purposes.

Job codes are meant as a convenience way to map several customer job codes to one defined in Taleo.
This concept is optional and mainly for use for system to system integration. Job codes are only available for management through the Connect interface.
The job field of the job role.
The job level of the job role.
The job profile that specifies the requirements to execute a job.
A job role has a code, name and definition for documentation purposes
The description of the job.
Plain text version of the job role definition description field that supports rich-text markup. This field is automatically converted and filled when populating the job role definition description.
The qualifications of the job.

Plain text version of the job role definition qualifications field that supports rich-text markup. This field is automatically converted and filled when populating the job role definition qualifications.
The responsibilities of the job.

Plain text version of the job role definition responsibilities field that supports rich-text markup. This field is automatically converted and filled when populating the job role definition responsibilities.
Job Schedule lookup values. It determines the available job schedule types in the system.
Job Shift lookup values. It determines the available job shifts in the system.
Job Type lookup values. It determines the available job types in the system.
The relative importance of a profile element.
The unique code of the profile importance.
The specific value for a rated requirement
The rating dimension used in the requirement evaluation.
The target rating value of the requirement evaluation (part of the rating dimension specified for this requirement value)

BasePool is the generic definition of an extensible and reusable solution. A pool identifies a list of items (Persons, Candidates, Employees, Goals, Requisitions, etc) and provides actions on it. Assign development activities, match pool members to requisitions, plan and forecast resources availability are some examples of usages of pools.
The unique identifier of this entity.
This field contains the date at which the pool was created.
This field contains a brief description of what the pool is for. This field is multilingual.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
This field contains the name of the pool. This field is multilingual.
This is the unique internal identifier of a pool.

This relation contains the user that has created the pool. The owner is the user that creates the pool and manage it. He can comments the pool, add user that can add-remove-comment items in the pool. The owner can add-remove-comment items in the pool.
This relations contains the list of the users that can manipulate the pool. They can add-remove-comment, items in the pool.

A nomination pool is a list of people (nominees) that have been suggested as potential incumbents for a specific position. Access to the nomination pool is usually limited to the owner who is also the position's manager. However, there is no restriction to who can nominate a person.

A position is an occurrence of a Job Role. It can also be represented by the chair. Positions are hierarchical. It defines the business employee structure. Typically, the topmost positions are managed by HR team in the system. Other positions can be managed by managers.
The criticality on a scale of 1 to 5. However, in the current products, only a criticality level of 5 is considered "critical".
The JobPosition internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a job position identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
The description of the position.
Flag indicating if the position is open (without an incumbent employee)
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The number of employees for the position
The unique internal identifier of this entity.
The target start date of the position - typically use to manage new positions.
The department associated to the position.
The currently assigned employee filling the position.
The position job profile. It describes the specific requirements to occupy the position.
The job role associated to the position.
The location associated to the position.
The manager owner of the position.
The organization associated to the position.
The parent position in the position hierarchy.
This entity is a lookup containing the information on how did we learn about the candidate for a specific application.
Public identifier of the application medium.
This entity is a lookup representing a form of money that is in public circulation.
This field is the value of the currency in US dollars. This field is monthly updated.

This field represents the ISO4217 alphabetic code of the currency. In most cases, it is composed of the country's two-character Internet country code plus an extra character to denote the currency unit. For example, the code for Canadian Dollars is simply Canada's two-character Internet code ("CA") plus a one-character currency designator ("D").
This field represents the ISO4217 numeric code of the currency.
This field is the symbol of the currency. For instance th symbol of the US dollar is '$'.
This lookup entity represents a measurement Unit. For example: Kilometers or Miles.
Public identifier of the distance measure unit.
Employee Status lookup values. It determines the desired person's employement status.

HireType
This lookup entity indicates the hire type used (Professional, Hourly, Campus, etc.).
This lookup entity indicates who has feed the information about a candidate (Recruiter, Agent, ...)
Public identifier of the info feeder.
This entity represent a language that is supported by our applications.
Public identifier of the language.
The ISO code of the language.
This class is a lookup that display the phone type. i.e Home Phone, Work Phone, etc.
This class define the visibility associated with recruitment source.
The unique code.
Indicates which languages are required to be filled for a user defined selection. This value can be one of: both content and webtop languages, or webtop languages only.
Public identifier of the required languages.

The UDSElement entity models user-defined selection elements. A selection element is a possible value of the selection (discrete value). A selection element may then be used as a UDF (user-defined field) value.
Indicates if this selection element is active. An inactive element will normally be hidden in the user interface.
An alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the element.

Indicates if the selection element has all the required information entered. The required information is the description for all content languages. An incomplete element should not be shown in the UI.
The UDSElement internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a UDSElement identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
The descriptive name of the selection element.
The date from element takes effect, if any. The effectiveFrom and effectiveTill fields are considered by the system only if their parent selection enables effective dates.
The date the element becomes inactive, if any.
The last modification date of the UDSElement
The unique identifier of this entity.
The default display sequence of the element.
JobFields for which this selection element is active.
Locations for which this selection element is active.
Organizations for which this selection element is active.
Indicates in which selection this element belongs. That selection's attributes influence how an element is to be used and displayed in the user interface.
The UserDefinedSelection entity models user-defined selections. A selection (domain of discrete values) may then be used to define user-defined fields.
Alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the selection.
The UserDefinedSelection internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a UserDefinedSelection identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.

Indicates if the elements of this selection can specify an activation period. If this field is set to false, any dates in the 'effectiveFrom' and 'effectiveTill' fields of the elements will not be considered.
Indicates that this selection handles a large amount of elements.
Descriptive name of the selection.
The unique identifier of this entity.
Indicates if all elements of this selection must be linked to at least one structure element.
The meta-class of one of the following: Organization, Location, JobField. Elements linked to this selection must only be linked to that type of structure.
Contains the elements of this selection.
Indicates the origin of this selection (either built in by Taleo, or company-specific data).
Indicates which languages are required to make this user-defined selection complete.
Will Travel lookup values. It determines the person's likeliness to travel.
This a value associated to a WillTravel record used for computation.
A work item represents a task that is assigned to a user of the Taleo system.
A comment entered by the user who created the work item.
The date and time the work item was created.
The user to whom this workitem is assigned.
The user who created the workitem.
The state of the work item before being put on hold.
The current state of the work item.
The type of work item.
Defines categories in which work items can be classified. Currently two categories exist: Assignable and Automatic.

Defines states in which a work item can be. There are currently two possible states.
Active, which indicates that the workitem is ready to be read and realized. This is the initial status. The second state is On Hold, which suspends a work item.
For example, when a requisition is put on hold, all its related workitems are automatically put on hold. They are resumed as soon as the requisition is resumed.
Defines the kinds of work items that exist in the Taleo system. Each type of work item is also associated to a category.
Describes the action that the user receiving this type of work item is expected to take.
The category in which this work item type is classified.

FOR TALEO INTERNAL USE ONLY
This Entity is reserved for internal communication with the Compensation Application and will not be accessible via TCC or TCB at runtime. Do not use.
Class that represents a department of the company.
The department cost center (multilingual).
The Department internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a department identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
The date when the department is effective.
The date when the department stops being effective.
The last modification date of the department
The unique identifier of this entity.
The department Pay Factor (eg: 1 = 100%).
The hiring manager associated to the department.
The department location.
The department organization.
The department parent of the current department.
The recruiter associated to the department.

An employee is the top-level object representing an employee. At this level, the information is distinct from the other possible types of talent users (candidate and contact). Only employee specific information is contained in this object (as described in the field/relations below). Most of the overall person information is contained in the related TalentUser and User objects.
True if a profile confirmation is required at next employee login.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
True if the employee has been matched to an existing candidate profile. False if a brand new candidate has been created and associated to this employee.
The compensation history of the employee
The current job of the employee, a direct reference to one of the active job roles of the system.
The matrix managers associated to the employee.
The employee compensations
Employee metrics associated to the employee.
Employee picture associated to the employee.
Current employment status associated to the employee.
The location of the employee.
The manager of the employee.
The organization of the employee.

The link towards the generic talent user entity that contains profile type information.
This link will also bring you towards the user entity that contains personal type information.
The employee picture contains an image of the likeness of the employee. Currently only the JPG format is supported and the size must be small.
the checksum of the picture
The picture contains an image of the likeness of the employee. It is resized (48x48) and compress in the jpeg format
The picture contains an image of the likeness of the employee. It is resized (256x256) and compress in the jpeg format. This field is updated when the picture field value is changed.
The current employment status of the employee.
The unique code of this enumeration value.
Interest Internaltional Assignment lookup values. It determines the level of interest for a person in beeing relocated internationally.
The unique code of this enumeration value.

MatrixManager determines the relationship between an employee and an external manager. Usually, matrix managers are people requested by the employee's direct manager to have access to one or more of his employees. It usually takes place during a delegation or temporary replacement of managment responsibilities. A matrix manager is also known as a proxy.
Indicates if the tasks about one of the managed employees are to be delegated to the matrix manager.
The date the matrix manager starts to have access to specified employees.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The date the matrix manager stops having access to specified employees.
The employees associated to the matrix manager. The matrix manager has access and responsibilites on these employees.
The employee requester for a matrix manager. It represents the manager who delegated its reponsibilities on a matrix manager.
The employee associated to the matrix manager. It represents the matrix manager itself.

This class is a lookup class that define all the possible values for the employee configurable metrics available in the system. The type specifided the kind of metric we are dealing with. The description can be edited by the user, the user can add or remove an image associated to a possible choice of values. The possible values can be actived or de-activated.
The employee metrics contains valuable and sensitive information regarding an employee.
The last official review competency score of the employee, normalized value between 0 and 1. This attribute may be null if no score was provided in the system.
The date the last official review competency score of the employee has been set.
The last official review goal score of the employee, normalized value between 0 and 1. This attribute may be null if no score was provided in the system.
The date the last official review goal score of the employee has been set.
The last official review score of the employee, normalized value between 0 and 1. This attribute may be null if no score was provided in the system.
The date the last official review score of the employee has been set.

The promotability readiness metric determines in what time frame the employee will be ready for a promotion.
The set date indicates the moment that the information was captured.
For example, a promotability readiness set date, start and end equal to 01/12/07, 6, 12 means that on Dec 1st, 2007, it was evaluated that the employee is ready for a promotion in 6 months to 1 year.
It is important to note that the readiness estimate does not change automatically when time elapses. On May 1st, the employee will still show a 6-12 months readiness time frame (just that this information was captured on Dec 1st).
To be documented.
To be documented.
Employee associated to the employee metrics.
The potential of the employee to be promoted to another job or position.
The risk of losing this employee to an internal transfer or an external company.
This class is a lookup class that define all the possible employee metric types available in the system. For now the types are sourced by Taleo only.
Will Relocate lookup values. It determines the level of interest for a person in beeing relocated.
The unique code of this enumeration value.
This entity represents an employer where a candidate acquired work experience.
the creation date of the employer
The name of the employer.
The last modification date of the employer
The unique internal id of the Employer
The status of the CieEmployer

This entity represents an experience that a person has working, or working in a specific field or occupation.
(removeCheckOnCreate=true,removeCheckOnRead=true, removeCheckOnUpdate=true, removeCheckOnDelete=true)
This field is the date when the candidate began working for this job.
This field indicates if it is or not the employer for whom the candidate is currently working.

This field determines the order to display this experience among the candidate's experiences. It's also a part of the key (Candidate, Requisition, PorfileLangange, displaySequence) identifying a specific candidate's experience for a specific application and for a specific profile language.
This field is the date when the candidate stopped working for this job.
The last modification date ot the Experience
This field defines the name the candidate was using when working for this company.
The unique internal id of the entity
This field is used when the candidate's employer is not listed in the employers list. It contains the candidate's employer name.
This field is used when the candidate's job function is not listed in the job functions list. It contains the candidate's job function name.
This field hold the value to identity if the recruiter have the permission to contact the old supervisor.
Contains the reason why the person left this employer.
This field is the description of the responsibilities the candidate had or has for this job.
This field is the name of the candidate's supervisor.
This field hold the value of the supervisor address email.
This field is the phone number of the candidate's supervisor.
This field hold the value of the supervisor title during the employment.
Link the experience to the profile information.
This field represents the employer related to the candidate's experience.
This field represents the job function related to the candidate's experience.
Indicate where this employer is located.

FOR TALEO INTERNAL USE ONLY
This Entity is reserved for internal communication with the Compensation Application and will not be accessible via TCC or TCB at runtime. Do not use.
To be documented.
The name of the custom field
The potential of the employee to be promoted to another job or position.
The risk of losing this employee to an internal transfer or an external company.
Reassignment lookup values. It determines the level of readiness for a person in beeing assigned for a different job.
Application certifications are the certifications that the candidate has entered in the context of the application.
This field holds the date received certification.
This field determines the order to display this application certification among the candidate's application certifications.
This field holds the expiration date of the certifications..
this is the key field
This field holds the certification ID enter by the candidate.
This field holds the certification issuing organization.
This field hold the value for the other certification name if it is not part of the list.
This relation define the application related to the certifications.
The certification
This relation hold the location where the candidate received the certifications.

Contains all the text datas that a candidate can provide. It contains datas like the cover letter, pasted resume, career objectives and additional informations.
removeCheckOnDelete=true)
The additional information that the candidate provided.
The career objectives that the candidate provided.
The cover letter that the candidate provided.
The pated resume that the candidate provided.
The profile information for which those datas applies to.
The profile is the set of information describing the person at a professional and educational level. The profile is not related to any specific job posting.
The ProfileInformation

Application is the centerpiece of the selection process. All actions and events are based and take place on the application. An application is created as soon as a candidate is matched to a requisition, whatever the way (mail application, use of career section, automatic match, reference).
The date on which the application has been created.
Indicate if the application has been made by an internal employee. True if the employee was an internal one at the moment he applies on the requisition, false otherwise.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
Indicates the language in which the person's profile has been filled.
The unique internal id of the entity
To be documented.
This relation define the certifications related to the application.
All the text datas that a candidate can add to his application. For now the candidate can submit his pasted resume, career objectives, cover letter and additional information.
This is the talent user profile list of experiences.
This relation define the references the candidate will attach to his application or profile.
The list of the candidate studies, educations, related to the application.
Minimal information enabling to identify or reach a person. A reference can be a person a supervisor or boss in the case of work experience.
This field hold the value for the company name the reference work.
This field determines the order to display this reference among the candidate's references.
This field hold the value for the email of the reference.
This field hold the value for the fax number of the reference.
This field hold the first name of the reference.
This field hold the last name of the reference.
This field hold the middle Initial of the reference.
This entity key
This field hold the value for the phone number of the reference.
This field hold the value for the relationship of the reference. I.e Boss, mother, etc.
This field hold the value for the job function title of reference
The application on which the reference is associated.
This relation defines the country of the reference.
This relation define the type of relation the reference is associated.
This class define the type of reference the candidate can have. i.e Personal, Occupational, etc
This entity represents a place designated for learning. It is the educational institution where people learn specific knowledge.
The last creation date of the institution
This field is the name of the institution.
The last modification date of the institution
The unique identifier of this entity.
Contains the location of the institution.
The status of the Institution
Indicate the type of institution. University, College, school, etc,,,
This entity represents an educational program. It's a field of study. For example: Information Technology, Journalism, Political Science, etc...
The creation date of the Study
This field is the name of the program in multiplie languages.
The last modification date of the Study
The status of the Program

This entity represents a part of candidate's resume. It describes one of his/her educational degree and history.
(removeCheckOnCreate=true,removeCheckOnRead=true, removeCheckOnUpdate=true, removeCheckOnDelete=true)

This field determines the order to display this study among the candidate's studies. It's also a part of the key (Candidate, Requisition, PorfileLangange, displaySequence) identifying a specific candidate's study for a specific application and for a specific profile language.

This field (Grade Point Average) is a number that represents the average of a student's grades during his or her time at an institution. Usually it is weighted by number of credits given for the course.
This field is the maximum grade value at the institution.
This field holds the value if the candidate graduate from high school or receive a GED (General Education Development)
This field is the date when the candidate has received his academic degree.
This field holds the value to identify if the graduated date is a projected date.
The last modification date of the entity
This fields hold the value for the name use by the candidate when attending at the time of education.
The unique internal identifier of this entity.
This field is used when the candidate's program is not listed in the programs list. It contains the candidate's program name.
This field holds the value for the other location city if the institution list doesn't contains the value the candidate need.
This field is used when the candidate's institution is not listed in the institutions list. It contains the candidate's institution name.
This field contains the date of the beginning of the candidate's program.
This field represents the application related to the candidate's study.
This field represents the institution where the candidate studied.
This relation define the location for the other institution if not available in the selector.
This field represents the program related to the candidate's study.
This field represents the education level related to the study. For example: High school diploma.
Study Level lookup values. It determines the education levels a person has or intends to reach.
This entity is a lookup representing the list of possible type of institution: for example: University, College, school, etc,,,
The public identifier of the type of institution.
Rater type lookup values. The rater type determines who has provided the competency answer.
The unique code of the rater type.
The talent competency determines the set of answers provided for a competency. A competency can be rated on many dimensions.
Indicates if the answer has been provided in a simple or detailed manner.
To be documented.
The competency associated to the talent competency.
To be documented.
To be documented.
To be documented.
To be documented.
To be documented.
To be documented.
Link to the the talent user.
The talent competency value represents one answer provided for a competency.
The rating dimension associated to the talent competency value. It indicates which dimension of the competency is rated.
The rating value associated to the talent competency value. It indicates the rating value provided for the rated dimension.
The rater type associated to the talent competency value.
The talent competency associated to the talent competency value.

The talent user is the common person information layer. A person can be a candidate, an employee, a contact, or any combination of these types. The talent user also contains a part of the person's profile and job preferences. Remaining part of the profile is found via the profile relationship.
removeCheckOnCreate=true)
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The unique internal identifier of this entity.
Number of years in the current industry field.
Number of years of management experience.
Link to the user associated to the TalentUser). The user entity provides common information and access to the products via the user accounts.
The user as an employee.
The desired employee statuses associated to the person.
The level of interest associated to the person in being relocated internationally.
The desired or preferred job fields associated to the person.
The desired job levels associated to the person.
The desired job schedules associated to the person.
The desired job types associated to the person.
The desired or preferred locations associated to the person.
The desired or preferred organizations associated to the person.
The talent user preferences associated to the person.
To be documented.
The level of readiness associated to the person in beeing reassigned.
The desired study levels associated to the person.
Link to the the talent user rated competencies. It contains all the competency answers provided by the person itself or by another person.
The level of interest associated to the person in being relocated.
The desired travel options associated to the person.

Represents the preferences that the candidate can configure from the Career Site. The candidate selects the values that fit him best and save them in the database via this entity. These preferences are later checked by the process that must take them into account. For example, the "sendApplicationAknowledgement" attribute must be checked to determine if the related corresponding must be sent to a candidate.
Contains the language in which the Career Site must be displayed to the candidate or agent.
Contains the language in which the correspondence must be sent to the candidate or agent. When no value is selected, the language of the last general application is used instead.
Indicate the the TalentUser does not want to receive any email.
Last referral list access date
Last submission list access date

Contains the time zone selected by the candidate or agent. If the candidate or agent did not select a time zone, the system will use the time zone corresponding to the candidate's residence. If the residence has not been provided by the candidate, the system will take the time zone of the browser. Finally, if no time zone can deducted from the request, the default time zone (company setting) will be taken into account.
Determines if the Acknowledgement Letter must be sent to the candidate or not.
Determines if the Job Posting Notification must be sent to the candidate or not. If yes, it takes the value of attribute "jobPostingNoticeFrequency" into account.

Determines if the Job Agent Notification(s) must be sent to the candidate or not. If yes, it takes the value of attribute "jobPostingNoticeFrequency" into account, unless it has been explicitly overridden in the job agent itself.
Determines if the Rejection Letter (sent when a requisition is filled or canceled) must be sent to a candidate.

A business organization is a unit of the company. It has a common set of goals within a business plan. A business organization is an aggregated view of the HR organization structure.
In some cases, the business organization structure may be the exact replica of the HR organization structure.
Structure should be limited to 2 or 3 levels to keep it simple. - Business unit - Division
The Business Organization internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a business organization identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
Business Organization specific level.
Business organization specific sequence.
Class that represents company-specific Job Fields. This is the list of company employment domains, with a hierarchical view.
The JobField internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a jobfield identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
Indicates if jobfield is locked or not
Associated Network JobField for this Company JobField
Company JobField specific level
Company JobField specific sequence

Class that represents a company"s specific location. A company location represents a geographical region. Only locations that are useful to the company are present in this structure. Location is used in the application to define a country; it could also define a State (or province), a region and a city. It usually describes locations where activities happen within the company. As far as country, state and region are concerned, they should be a subset of the reference location structure.
The Location internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a location identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
Associated Network Location for this Company Location
Company location specific level
Company Location specific sequence
Class that represents the Taleo Reference Industry
Unique identifier allowing providing a meaningful key
Unique identifier generated by system
Abstract class representing the common attributes and relations of a Job Field.
Abstract class representing a geographical location.
Abbreviation of the location
Zip code of the location
Class that represents network Job Field. This is the list of employment domains, with a hierarchical view.
Network JobField specific level
Network JobField specific sequence

Class that represents a network-specific location. Taleo locations are a list of locations from around the world. They are usually used to generate the locations of a company, and they are also used in the Career Section to help a candidate select the actual location. They also represent the location used to do a posting, since posting is often done based on a "region" (which is less detailed than the city used in Location). The reference location structure has 3 levels: country, province/state and region.
ISO3166Alpha3 code of the location
Latitude of the location
Longitue of the location
Network location specific level
Network Location specific sequence
Regroupment of Organization(s), Location(s) and JobField(s)

Class that represents a company-specific Organization. It describes the divisional structure of the company. This includes, but is not restricted to, company, location, division, area, department and workgroup.
The Organization internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing an organization identifier known in another external system for integration purpose
Associated Industry for this Organization
Organization specific level
Organization specific sequence
Represent the Work Location of the latest location level
the address of the work location
The address of the work location
the city of the work location
the code of the work location
The role represent the role of an actor; it can be a system role or a user defined role.
The Hierarchical role represent a role hierarchy within a business. This role is assigned to users. There can be one and only one parent of the role in the hierarchy..
The regional assigne represent a user map on a userdefined role.

The user defined role represent a role that is created and modified by the user. This role can have a regional assignee. The user defined role must have a default assignee to fall back when no other user can be resolved.
To be documented.
